TopicTitle: [1.12.5] Bluedog Design Bureau - Stockalike Saturn, Apollo, and more! (v1.13.0 "Забытый" 13/Aug/2023)

Articles.Content:
5 minutes ago, Invaderchaos said:

Some progress on the Pioneer Uranus Probe:


That is SO COOL!

2 hours ago, Morphisor said:

 

 

As far as I can tell from your posts, @birdog357 you're running into a contract configurator limitation. What's happening is that I limited the amount of contracts BDB can offer at any one time, to prevent your mission control being spammed by them (there's 13 in total if memory serves).

What happens next is down to the contract generation done by contract configurator, not the contracts themselves. Unfortunately this system sometimes just doesn't load in a specific contract even when conditions are met. I've done a lot of testing on this myself, and the only advice I can give you is, that if you REALLY want a specific mission, you're just gonna have to accept and decline missions until the generator rngesus smiles on you. Sometimes it helps fast-forwarding time a bunch of days.

Sorry I can't be of more help. Contract configurator is a great addition to the game but has a bunch of limitations and oddities in it.

I was afraid it was going to be something like that. It seems to have broken the log jam at this point. My issue was if I had continued the logical mission progression, it would have meant I could never have accepted a given contract. Thanks for response.

3 minutes ago, Zorg said:

Getting things functional

12 hours ago, Yuriy Istochnikov said:

 

ADORABLE!!!!

Can't wait for launching this. 

Just a question... will you make also the Pioneer-Jupiter combo Orbiter-Probe (Contract NAS-2-6859 seen in your first post i'm quoting), or me should choose between orbiting or a probe?

So this is where it got a little tricky... The propulsion unit for Pioneer Orbiter-Probe is completely different from Pioneer Orbiter. Given that I would really not prefer to make a whole new orbiter propulsion unit especially considering the first one took long enough, I'm making a 0.625m Probe adapter part that interfaces with the Orbiter propulsion unit that can accommodate the probe. The consequence of this is that the spacecraft will be a little taller, but other than that the capabilities will be the same. It should still be able to fit in the Titan IIIE fairing. Additionally, I am making a variant of the relay antenna part that is angled and longer as seen in the contract you are referring to.

3 hours ago, Zorg said:

If anyone has a lead on any fairing options I might have missed (non historical etc) keen to hear and consider.

not really BDB specific but a set of generic SAF fairings for all sizes would be nice. really just 3.75m, 5m needs stuff. SAF is an amazing system but their aren't really any for the larger diameters.
Is there a possibility for early Landsat parts, to supplement the Nimbus parts already in the mod?

7 hours ago, SpaceFace545 said:

not really BDB specific but a set of generic SAF fairings for all sizes would be nice. really just 3.75m, 5m needs stuff. SAF is an amazing system but their aren't really any for the larger diameters.

I would consider rescaling some 4.25m and 6.25m fairings to 3.75m and 5m. But in the meantime the SAF KW rocketry pack provides decent alternatives. SAF was originally made by blowfish to provide extra functionality to the KW fairings in fact. The additional development then took place later when we started making BDB fairings.

This should have 3.75, 5 and even 7.5m fairings (rescaled from 5m for the latter I think)

https://github.com/blowfishpro/SimpleAdjustableFairings-KWRocketry

Upon further investigation, it turns out that the Atlas Surface Attach extra was messing with the Saturn S-1E/1F tank's ability to be radially attached, as both had the line: bdbTankType = bdbBalloon (unlike the other Saturn tanks). deleting the extra (or that line) resolves the issue.

2 hours ago, Jcking said:

Upon further investigation, it turns out that the Atlas Surface Attach extra was messing with the Saturn S-1E/1F tank's ability to be radially attached, as both had the line: bdbTankType = bdbBalloon (unlike the other Saturn tanks). deleting the extra (or that line) resolves the issue.

Oh probably best to patch the desired attach rules after the Atlas patch. not having tank bdbTankType = bdbBalloon on the S1F tank could lead to potential problems with the fuel switcher and correct dry mass.
